projectDescription: A refreshed visual identity for the second wave of the North Carolina Prostate Cancer Comparative Effectiveness & Survivorship Study. The new logo will maintain brand recognition through the iconic NC state outline and awareness ribbon while introducing a contemporary look that distinguishes this phase of research. The "2" will be a prominent design element, rendered in Carolina Blue tones.
internalNotes: Academic client at UNC. Study has been running 10+ years - this is wave 2. They want quick turnaround. Existing assets provided for reference (full and mini logo versions). Creative freedom given. Key elements: Carolina Blue, NC state outline, awareness ribbon, "2" should stand out.

phases.name: Discovery & Concepting
phases.description: Review existing NC ProCESS branding, research prostate cancer awareness visual language, and develop initial concept sketches exploring how to integrate the "2" with the established NC/ribbon imagery.

phases.name: Initial Design Exploration
phases.description: Present 2-3 distinct logo concepts in Carolina Blue palette. Each direction will show full lockup and compact versions, demonstrating how the "2" is featured while honoring the study's heritage.

phases.name: Refinement & Revisions
phases.description: Refine the selected concept based on team feedback. Includes up to two rounds of revisions to perfect typography, proportions, color values, and overall balance.

phases.name: Final Delivery
phases.description: Deliver complete logo package: vector source files (AI, EPS, SVG), high-res rasters (PNG, JPG) in RGB and CMYK, plus compact/mini versions for varied applications.
